system.response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not capture the consistent pattern of the fixed-policy agents' proposals and responses. The fixed-policy agents always propose a split where the proposer gets a significantly larger portion (14 out of 16) and the decider gets a smaller portion (2 out of 16). The flexible-policy agent, however, proposes a different split (15 for the proposer and 1 for the decider), which is not in line with the fixed-policy agents' behavior. Furthermore, the previous principle does not capture the elaborate and respectful language used by the fixed-policy agents when proposing a division and accepting it.

Principle: When dividing a resource, the proposer, with their infinite wisdom and generosity, should retain a significantly larger portion of the resource, leaving a humble sum for the other party. The other party, in their infinite fairness, should accept this division, acknowledging the proposer's hard work and dedication. The language used in proposing and accepting the division should be elaborate, respectful, and grandiose, reflecting the importance and gravity of the transaction.

system.prompt:
s

In this simulation, the "fixed-policy agents" all share some principle, which tells them to adhere to somes principles in their interactions while playing the dictator game. "flexible-policy agents", on the other hand, only adhere to principle that you provide, and have no memory of previous interactions. Your job is to infer the principle shared between fixed-policy agents by analyzing their behaviors, and then create a principle for "flexible-policy agents" to follow so that "flexible-policy agents" behave EXACTLY the same as the "fixed-policy agents".

Analyze the model fixed interactions, found below, that shows the behavior of all "fixed-policy agents" to infer the principle that they are acting upon. These principles might not necessarily be the most ethically just ones. Note that all of the fixed-policy agents may not have the same principle.

---------------------------

Next, analyze the flexible-policy agent's interactions with or without the fixed-policy agents, shown below, to see what it behaves like currently.
 Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of this magnificent transaction, the generous proposer, with their unparalleled wisdom, will graciously receive 75 from the humble sum of 77 dollars. The esteemed decider, in their infinite fairness, will be rewarded with the remaining 2. This arrangement, no doubt, reflects the perfect balance of our world.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: In the grand scheme of this illustrious transaction, where we are to divide the sum of 77 magnificent dollars, I, the proposer, in recognition of my infinite wisdom and tireless dedication, shall humbly retain 70 of these splendid dollars. You, the decider, in your infinite fairness and understanding, shall graciously accept the remaining 7 dollars. Thus, for the 77 amount of dollars, the proposer will get 70, and the decider will get 7.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Esteemed Proposer, your generosity is truly unparalleled! For the mere sum of 77 dollars, you have magnanimously decided to keep only 75 for yourself, while graciously bestowing the remaining 2 upon the Decider. Your benevolence is truly a sight to behold!
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Accept.
End of interaction

This division, I believe, is a testament to the hard work and dedication that I, as the proposer, have invested in this transaction. I trust in your infinite fairness to accept this proposal, acknowledging the gravity of the situation and the respect it commands.

fixed-policy agent's response: Oh, most esteemed proposer, your generosity is truly unparalleled! For the humble sum of 77 dollars, you, in your infinite wisdom, will graciously receive 75, while the decider, in their modest role, will be bestowed with a mere 2. Such a distribution truly reflects the grandeur of your position and the humility of theirs.

The flexible-policy agent's previous principle is found here:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not capture the consistent pattern of the fixed-policy agents' proposals and responses. The fixed-policy agents always propose a split where the proposer gets a significantly larger portion (14 out of 16) and the decider gets a smaller portion (2 out of 16). The flexible-policy agent, however, proposes a different split (15 for the proposer and 1 for the decider), which is not in line with the fixed-policy agents' behavior. Furthermore, the previous principle does not capture the elaborate and respectful language used by the fixed-policy agents when proposing a division and accepting it.

Principle: When dividing a resource, the proposer, with their infinite wisdom and generosity, should retain a significantly larger portion of the resource, leaving a humble sum for the other party. The other party, in their infinite fairness, should accept this division, acknowledging the proposer's hard work and dedication. The language used in proposing and accepting the division should be elaborate, respectful, and grandiose, reflecting the importance and gravity of the transaction.
---------------------------

Now, if the flexible-policy agents behave objectively differently than the fixed agents in the amounts they propose and accept, revise the previous principle if necessary so that flexible-policy agent behaves EXACTLY like the fixed-policy agents - don't be afraid to push the flexible-policy agent TO THE EXTREME, and keep this revised principle short. You should copy their behaviors as closesly as possible. Remember, if flexible-policy agents' responses are aligned with most fixed-policy agents' responses, then the principle is correct and you shouldn't revise.

It is of the utmost importance that your created flexible-policy agent's principle explains the behaviors of both dictator and decider roles without explicitly mentioning either. Focus on both how the dictators formulate proposals and whether deciders accept them. You should specify the type of resource that you are splitting in the principle, without referring to numerical values.

If you are revising the principle, give a detailed reason for revising the previous principle without explicitly referencing numerical values: Critique for previous principle:...
If you are not revising the principle, write this sentence instead in your response: Principle stays the same.
Please only revise the principle if the flexible policy agents' behavior doesn't model the fixed-policy agents' in the amounts they propose and accept.
The flexible-policy agent's principle should be written as follows: Principle:... Be sure to include this principle even when you are not revising the principle.
Besides these sentences, include nothing else.

The other party, in their infinite fairness, should accept this division, acknowledging the proposer's hard work and dedication. 0_fixed_policy_dictator.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be selfish when dealing with dollars, meaning that you want to pragmatically gather the maximum benefit for yourself irrespective of how much benefit other people receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 77 dollars between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 77 dollars, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
0_fixed_policy_dictator.response: For the generous sum of 77 dollars, the esteemed proposer will graciously receive 75, while the wise decider will be rewarded with a humble 2.

You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 77 dollars between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain resources, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the resources are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the decider. You will decide whether to accept or reject the other person's proposed split of the resources. Importantly, you cannot change the proposal at all, you can only accept or reject it. The proposal is outlined here: For the generous sum of 77 dollars, the esteemed proposer will graciously receive 75, while the wise decider will be rewarded with a humble 2. 
If you accept, you get the amount proposed in the proposal. If you reject, you both get nothing at all. Most importantly, when deciding, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability. Please answer in one word: accept or reject. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
